header.title: Serena Williams war with umpire Carlos Ramos intensifies as ITF release statement
header.subtitle: SERENA WILLIAMS’ war with umpire Carlos Ramos has intensified as the sport’s governing body, the International Tennis Federation (ITF), have released a statement.
header.postText: 'The ITF were initially reluctant to get involved in the feud, which was sparked during the US Open final, but they have now given their backing to Ramos.', 'Williams was handed a game-penalty at 5-4 down against Naomi Osaka - a move which ultimately sealed her defeat and ensured her chance of catching Margaret Court’s all-time record of 24 Grand Slam titles is delayed.', 'The punishment was issued for three offences: receiving on-court coaching from Patrick Mouratoglou, smashing up her racket and verbally abusing the umpire.', 'When Osaka was handed the bonus game, Williams blasted the official a thief and the American has since been backed by the WTA.', 'However, the ITF have come out in backing of Ramos as sexism claims also come to light.', 'Carlos Ramos is one of the most experienced and respected umpires in tennis, the statement began.', 'Mr. Ramos’ decisions were in accordance with the relevant rules and were re-affirmed by the US Open’s decision to fine Serena Williams for three offences.', 'It is understandable that this high profile and regrettable incident should provoke debate.', 'At the same time, it is important to remember that Mr. Ramos undertook his duties as an official according to the relevant rule book and acted at all time with professionalism and integrity.', 'WTA chief executive Steve Simon has backed Williams over the controversial saga.', 'He said: “Yesterday’s US Open final resulted in the crowning of a deserving new champion, Naomi Osaka.', 'The WTA applauds Naomi for her tremendous achievement.', 'Yesterday also brought to the forefront the question of whether different standards are applied to men and women in the officiating of matches.', 'The WTA believes that there should be no difference in the standards of tolerance provided to the emotions expressed by men vs women and is committed to working with the sport to ensure that all players are treated the same.We do not believe that this was done last night.', 'We also think the issue of coaching needs to be addressed and should be allowed across the sport.', 'The WTA supports coaching through its on - court coaching rule, but further review is needed.', 'Yesterday's match showcased one of tennis's new stars as well as one of the greatest players of the game. We look forward to more thrilling matches between these great athletes and hope that what we all witnessed yesterday never happens again.'
